title: Life in the Time of Corona: Week 1
description: I've decided to document my experience of the Covid 19 pandemic. This will be a time my kids probably remember forever, so I figured it'd be good to keep a record of the goings on. And yes this is the closest to a "mom blog" I've ever gotten to...will post thoughts every few weeks or so

transcript_parts.text: in lieu of an interview this week I
figured it would be good to just have a
little record of my thoughts and
feelings during this time and I figured
hey I have a YouTube channel man I'll
deposit to these thoughts and feelings
there
so I'd like to go over a little
background first of where I've come in
regards to my feelings about this time
and the virus and whatnot
I mean you hear about it in the news
that sounds really rough and horrible or
places far away um but it isn't - really
until well even when it came here I I
wasn't super worried because I I figured
well it's not really in my province and
I mean we're afraid of what most excess
in our daily lives typically those kind

and think about such things um with a

when province decided to close all the

they made the announcement
my son was invited to a birthday party
and I was not sure if we should go I was
kind of waffling flash feeling lazy I
kind of just decided okay maybe I guess
we just won't go I mean just in case you
know but now of course we wouldn't go so
then the announcement comes the next day
for the schools to be closed and I think
that's when it really hit me
that's when it made me think oh this is
really serious and the reason why the
schools were closed is because there had
been reports of the virus spreading
through the community it wasn't because
of someone traveling and coming back
with it it was the first time that
people were getting infected just from
contact with people within the city or
the province it made me yeah kind of
have a sobering feeling of okay this is
real and this thing does spread and its
local now
I imagine that many of you probably went
through these feelings let me know in
the comments I would love to know where
you guys are at about your feelings
journey if it was similar or very
different from mine
password to the the schools are closed
and now I'm homeschooling my kids there
are a few days of limbo I implemented a
schedule that was circulating around
friend of mine sent it to me so I made a
poster of it of the schedule that we'll
be using and we we actually started
using it right away we are doing I walk
every single morning at 9 o'clock we've
never actually gotten out right at 9:00
on the dot but we're we're going we're
trying our best we do get out though and
no matter how cold it is so we are the
kids are you know used to it they're
asking every morning all are we doing
our walk now so I'm glad to have a sort
of schedule in place so they can have a
feeling of security that you know we
know what we're doing and then we had a
few days of no content from the teachers
and I was just having them do leftover
homework assignments and making my own
little bit of creativity asks for them
to do and then on Thursday the school
came out with content videos through
Google classroom and so they watch the
video and then they have an assignment
and I have to kind of monitor that make
sure that they're doing it correctly and
then I have to take a picture of it and
submit it it's great that the school is
sending the info and that you know I'm
not having to make a curriculum but it's
also I mean I have two kids in school so
and I know some people have more than
two kids in school I have three kids but
my youngest is not quite four but he's
not not in school yet so I know some
people have more than two kids in school
and it just multitasking between the
kids so we actually went out found a
good deal on an iPad Mini because I just
I needed more screens for my kids to be
able to do their homework watch the
video and then do the the lesson it was
just much easier to have them each have
their own screen so thankfully we were
able to find a deal on that
it is just a small example of just
life-changing I know some people have to
stop work so that they can take care of
their kids
and my heart goes out to people in that
situation so it was overwhelming guys
doing this school like it's only it was
only two days but it it's I wrote this
on Twitter yesterday it has felt like an
age the past week since the school
closed found out on Sunday it has felt
like an absolute age like it could have
been months since all of this really
started happening and affecting like our
little family and and our lives and I
saw someone put up a note about how this

as you make it and those who are
affected by the virus in regards to who
actually have the virus I'm no I I'm so
sorry and if you are one of those people
watching and I hope you recover and can
get better but for those of us who are
not who are just kind of self quarantine
in an effort to stop the spread if we're
not sick we can do our best to make it
not just a bearable time but a really

school was shut down and we were at home
you know I definitely am I I'm telling

upset and they needs clarification for

tell them three times and I totally have
and but I'm I'm trying my best to not

come on just listen mode but I really
want to make this time for my kids
anytime this is getting kind of Mom Blog
--is-- so bear with me but yeah if you
do have kids though I mean it is
important to try to make it a good time
a time that
they feel is like exciting and fun and
an adventure and an attempt to learn
responsibility as well I feel like I've

and not too scary but not too carefree
like I want them to have a healthy
balance of but we have to be concerned
about the virus but not too scared of it
now one thing I do really love is the

they speak about this time ending in
